summary: The 'Essential Skills and Child Care for Health Professions Act' (H.R. 5375) aims to remove barriers to healthcare professions. It mandates demonstration projects funded under the health profession opportunity grant program to provide foundational educational training, such as English language proficiency and adult basic education, and requires the provision of affordable child care for participants. The bill amends the Social Security Act to include these provisions and sets an effective date of October 1, 2025.
